contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Political party |country = Belarus |name_english = Agrarian Party |name_native = [[Russian language|Russian]]:Агра́рная па́ртия<br>[[Belarusian language|Belarusian]]:Аграрная партыя |colorcode = red |logo = |leader = [[Mikhail Shimansky]] |president = |chairperson = |spokesperson = |leader1_name = |foundation = 1992 |headquarters = [[Minsk]] |newspaper = |youth_wing = |membership_year = |membership = |ideology = [[Agrarianism]], [[Socialism]] |national = |international = ''None'' |european = ''None'' |colors = |website = ''None'' |footnotes = }} The '''Agrarian Party''' ({{lang-ru|Агра́рная па́ртия}}, {{lang-be|Аграрная партыя}}, ''Agrarnaya Partya'') is a [[left-wing]] [[agrarianism|agrarian]] [[political party]] in [[Belarus]]. It supports the government of president [[Alexander Lukashenko]].<ref>[http://www.europeanforum.net/country/belarus]</ref> It was created in 1992 as the ''United Democratic Agrarian Party of Belarus (Аб'яднанная аграрна-дэмакратычная партыя Беларусі)''.<ref>[http://library.fes.de/pdf-files/bueros/belarus/07072.pdf]</ref> In 1994, it changed its name into Agrarian Party. Leader of the party is [[Mikhail Shimansky]]. At the [[Belarusian parliamentary election, 1995|legislative election in 1995]], the party obtained 33 out of 198 seats. In [[Belarusian parliamentary election, 2000|2000]] and [[Belarusian parliamentary election, 2004|2004]] it only gained 5 and 3 seats in the [[House of Representatives of Belarus|House of Representatives]], respectively. At the last [[Belarusian parliamentary election, 2008|parliamentary election in 2008]], the party was reduced to one seat. ==See also== *[[Agrarian Party of Russia]] *[[Agrarian Party of Ukraine]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Belarusian political parties}} [[Category:Agrarian parties]] [[Category:Political parties in Belarus]] [[Category:Articles lacking sources from June 2009]] [[Category:All articles lacking sources]] {{Belarus-party-stub}}
